name: Fancy Github Activity
author: Jeremy Zimmerman

sections.description:
Displays Github activity in a fancy way via shortcode which can be used in posts, pages, or widgets.

Notes

  • Languages: PHP and Javascript
  • Credits: caseyscarborough for his awesome github activity code.
  • Created this because didn’t like the bland looks of current WordPress Github activity plugins.
sections.installation:
1. Upload the plugin files to the /wp-content/plugins/fancy-github-activity directory, or install the plugin through the WordPress plugins screen directly.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ screen in WordPress
  3. Use shortcode [fancy-github-activity] where you would like it. Configurable options below.

Options:

  • username=”stopspazzing” // required
  • repository=”” // optional
  • limit=”20″ // optional

Example:
[fancy-github-activity username=”stopspazzing”]
sections.faq:
Installation Instructions

  1. Upload the plugin files to the /wp-content/plugins/fancy-github-activity directory, or install the plugin through the WordPress plugins screen directly.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ screen in WordPress
  3. Use shortcode [fancy-github-activity] where you would like it. Configurable options below.

Options:

  • username=”stopspazzing” // required
  • repository=”” // optional
  • limit=”20″ // optional

Example:
[fancy-github-activity username=”stopspazzing”]

What is the plugin license?

  • This plugin is released under a MIT license.
sections.changelog:
1.0.3

  • Code cleanup. Removed redundancies. Added plugin icon.

1.0.2

  • Updated to latest code from caseyscarborough.
  • Verified works on 4.9.x WordPress.

1.0.1

  • Compliance with WordPress Plugins requirements.
  • Completely working the way it should.
  • First release to WordPress.

0.1

  • Initial launch – unreleased
